channel.title: Twitter Search / ossia
channel.description: Twitter feed for: ossia. Generated by TwitRSS.me

item.title: I just put together this collection of stories from 300 developers who got their first tech job in their 30s, 40s, and 50s. And we're just getting started. Help me dispel the myth that only young people can learn to code. #DevAfter30 https://fcc.im/2qQmAC4
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)
item.description: I just put together this collection of stories from 300 developers who got their first tech job in their 30s, 40s, and 50s. And we're just getting started. Help me dispel the myth that only young people can learn to code. #DevAfter30 https://fcc.im/2qQmAC4

item.title:
I made some improvements to the freeCodeCamp forum: - Now you can see who's online and logged in - A leaderboard showcasing the most helpful people - freeCodeCamp font and color scheme (based on color theory)
Any ideas for how we can make the forum even more helpful for you?pic.twitter.com/0vhzhDGfNj
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)
item.description: I made some improvements to the freeCodeCamp forum: - Now you can see who's online and logged in - A leaderboard showcasing the most helpful people - freeCodeCamp font and color scheme (based on color theory) Any ideas for how we can make the forum even more helpful for you? pic.twitter.com/0vhzhDGfNj

item.title: I finally received my @freeCodeCamp front end web development certificate! The last project to me forever!! Thank you to @ossia for making this amazing tool I would have been lost without it. Starting my second round of #100DaysOfCode on Monday =)pic.twitter.com/fKRs5dEamV
item.dc:creator: (@TaIiaa_)
item.description: I finally received my @freeCodeCamp front end web development certificate! The last project to me forever!! Thank you to @ossia for making this amazing tool I would have been lost without it. Starting my second round of #100DaysOfCode on Monday =) pic.twitter.com/fKRs5dEamV

item.title: Congrats to @fearofpoets and her team for launching Grasshopper. It's a fun way to learn a bite-sized amount of coding every day on the go. https://thenextweb.com/apps/2018/04/19/google-employees-want-teach-code-free-cute-new-app/ …
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)

item.title:
How @anthonydmays - a foster kid from Compton - taught himself to code and eventually got a software engineering job at Google.
Several devs in the @freeCodeCamp community shared this with me this week. It's definitely worth your time (13 minute watch) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i1Pi4SQZGec …
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)
item.description: How @anthonydmays - a foster kid from Compton - taught himself to code and eventually got a software engineering job at Google. item.title: If you want to start a career in Front-End Development, check out this book-length guide to the field. It's free, open source, and up-to-date: https://legacy.gitbook.com/book/frontendmasters/front-end-developer-handbook-2018/details …pic.twitter.com/2JKSCP1jrt
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)

item.title: "Through a series of unfortunate events - divorce and an inability to afford school - I ended up in back in Missouri… bartending." The long, harrowing tale of how freeCodeCamp grad @fat_thunder got his first full time developer job at a game studio: https://forum.freecodecamp.org/t/1st-full-time-dev-position-a-video-game-studio/186474 …
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)

item.title: From my interview with @99percentlifest on the importance of us teaching everyone on Earth to code: "Software will help us make better decisions, help us design saner, more efficient systems, and ultimately alleviate a lot of the suffering in the world." https://www.99percentlifestyle.com/coding-the-future/ …
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)
item.description: From my interview with @99percentlifest on the importance of us teaching everyone on Earth to code: "Software will help us make better decisions, help us design saner, more efficient systems, and ultimately alleviate a lot of the suffering in the world." https://www.99percentlifestyle.com/coding-the-future/ …

item.title: This article is practically an education in the history of the internet, but more to the point, is the best explanation of and for Net Neutrality I've ever read. Thanks a lot, @ossia: https://medium.freecodecamp.org/inside-the-invisible-war-for-the-open-internet-dd31a29a3f08 …
item.dc:creator: (@ScribbleAddict)
item.description: This article is practically an education in the history of the internet, but more to the point, is the best explanation of and for Net Neutrality I've ever read. Thanks a lot, @ossia: https://medium.freecodecamp.org/inside-the-invisible-war-for-the-open-internet-dd31a29a3f08 …

item.title: I asked @EngineeredTruth to mentor me on how to improve freeCodeCamp's YouTube channel. He invited me onto his channel and live-streamed his in-depth critique of our videos. Super helpful advice if you're interested in YouTube (80 minute watch): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NtrMPlGVxhk …pic.twitter.com/NxJ7EIuoM3
item.dc:creator: (@ossia)
item.description: I asked @EngineeredTruth to mentor me on how to improve freeCodeCamp's YouTube channel. He invited me onto his channel and live-streamed his in-depth critique of our videos.
